articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Phil Stewart, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Iran and Israel traded air and missile strikes as the world braced on Monday for Tehran's response to the U.S. attack on its nuclear sites and U.S. President Donald Trump raised the idea of regime change in the Islamic republic.
articles.title: Iran weighs retaliation against U.S. for strikes on nuclear sites

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: Waves of Russian drones and missiles in and around Kyiv overnight killed 10 people including one child, lit up the night sky with fires in residential areas and damaged the entrance to a metro station bomb shelter, Ukrainian officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Russian attacks on Kyiv area kill 10 and injure dozens, Ukraine says

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: The NATO alliance has crafted a summit in The Hague this week to shore itself up by satisfying U.S. President Donald Trump with a big new defence spending goal - but it now risks being dominated by the repercussions of his military strikes on Iran.
articles.title: Hague NATO summit aims to focus on Trump's spending goal but Iran looms large

articles.author: Andrew Mills
articles.description: Qatar said on Monday it had shut down its airspace temporarily, hours after U.S. and British authorities contacted their citizens there recommending that they shelter in place until further notice.
articles.title: Qatar closes airspace, US and UK tell citizens to shelter in place

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced a new defence co-production initiative on Monday during a short visit by the Ukrainian president to London to discuss his country's defence against Russia.
articles.title: Starmer and Zelenskiy meet in London, agree military production project

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Dmitry Antonov
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that "unjustified" U.S. attacks on Iran's nuclear sites were pushing the world towards great danger and he promised to try to help the Iranian people, although did not spell out how.
articles.title: Putin says US strikes on Iran are pushing world to 'very dangerous line'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian forces on Monday attacked and set ablaze an oil depot in Russia's southern Rostov region used to supply Russian forces in occupied parts of Ukraine, the Ukrainian military said.
articles.title: Ukrainian forces attack oil depot in Russia's Rostov region

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Liberal Prime Minister Ilie Bolojan won a parliamentary confidence vote on Monday, ending months of political deadlock with a coalition government that aims to lower the EU's highest budget deficit to avoid losing its investment grade credit rating.
articles.title: Romania's broad coalition government wins parliament confidence vote

articles.author: Sergio Goncalves
articles.description: Portugal's centre-right minority government, under pressure from the far right to reduce immigration, said on Monday it would double to 10 years the amount of time most foreigners need to be legally resident in Portugal before applying for citizenship.
articles.title: Portugal tightens naturalisation rules, doubles residency requirement

articles.author: Alvaro Murillo
articles.description: Costa Rica's attorney general's office filed illicit campaign financing charges against President Rodrigo Chaves and six other government officials on Monday, asking the Supreme Court to lift the president's immunity and put him on trial.
articles.title: Costa Rican President Chaves charged with illicit campaign financing
